title: Computer-based weather forecast: New algorithm outperforms mainframe computer systems
text: The Paper «Low-cost scalable discretization, prediction, and feature selection for complex systems» co-authored by Prof Igor Horenko (High-Dimensional Data Analysis Laboratory) and published in “Science Advances” 2020, has made to the top-5% of all research outputs scored by Altmetric. It was featured by a number of media-outlets (https://scienceadvances.altmetric.com/details/75128729/news), including the “HPC Wire” magazine (https://www.hpcwire.com/2020/02/19/new-algorithm-allows-pcs-to-challenge-hpc-in-weather-forecasting/)

title: Attendance tripled at CSCS-USI Summer School 2020
text: The shift to online due to COVID-19 has done well to the numbers of this summer school: 100 students and working professionals logged on for the two-week series of lectures and “hands-on” labs to learn about CPU/GPU hybrid high-performance computing, with a special focus on data analytics.

title: Olaf Schenk elected in the Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics (SIAM)
text: The Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics has elected Professor Olaf Schenk as a SIAM Fellow in the class of 2020 for his contributions to applied mathematics and extreme-scale High-performance computing (HPC). The SIAM Fellows Class of 2020 includes 28 noteworthy professionals who have made significant contributions to the fields of applied mathematics and computational science.
